events.name: All these events do the same

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gustavo Marciano
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: YSort
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create an illusion of depth by setting the Z-order based on the Y position of the object. Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.

Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: YSort

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CurvedMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension allows to move objects on Bézier curve paths.
- Paths can be built dynamically or from predetermined paths in SVG format.
- A behavior moves objects in a given duration a bit like the Tween extension does.
- Another behavior moves objects using a speed and an acceleration.
- Expressions give access to the path trajectory values for more complex movements.

This extension can be used to:
- Move enemies that follow a pattern
- Animate decorations

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses
eventsFunctions.sentence: Define helper classes JavaScript code

events.inlineCode:
/** @type {Map<string, gdjs.__curvedMovementExtension.CurvedPath>} */
runtimeScene.__curvedMovementExtension = { curvedPaths: new Map() };

eventsFunctions.description: Append a cubic Bezier curve at the end of the path.
eventsFunctions.name: AddCubicCurve
eventsFunctions.sentence: Append a curve to the path _PARAM1_ relatively to the end: _PARAM8_, first control point: _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_, second control point: _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_,  destination: _PARAM6_ ; _PARAM7_

eventsFunctions.description: Append a cubic Bezier curve to the end of an object's path. The first control point is symmetrical to the last control point of the path.
eventsFunctions.name: AddSmoothCubicCurve
eventsFunctions.sentence: Append a smooth curve to the path _PARAM1_ relatively to the end: _PARAM6_, second control point: _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_,  destination: _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_

eventsFunctions.description: Append a line at the end of the path.
eventsFunctions.name: AddLine
eventsFunctions.sentence: Append a line to the path _PARAM1_ relatively to the end: _PARAM8_ first, control point: _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_, second control point: _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_,  destination: _PARAM6_ ; _PARAM7_

eventsFunctions.description: Append a line to close the path.
eventsFunctions.name: ClosePath
eventsFunctions.sentence: Close the path _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Create a path from SVG commands, for instance "M 0,0 C 55,0 100,45 100,100". Commands are: M = Move, C = Curve, S = Smooth, L = Line. Lower case is for relative positions. The preferred way to build the commands is to use an external SVG editor like Inkscape.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the object to a position by following a path.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Move on path to a position
eventsFunctions.name: MoveTo
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM0_ to _PARAM6_ ; _PARAM7_ on the path: _PARAM2_ repeated _PARAM3_ times in _PARAM4_ seconds with _PARAM5_ easing

parameters: AngleBetweenPositions(Object.X(), Object.Y(), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationY")) - AngleBetweenPositions(0, 0, Object.Behavior::PathEndX(), Object.Behavior::PathEndY())

DistanceBetweenPositions(Object.X(), Object.Y(), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationY")) / DistanceBetweenPositions(0, 0, Object.Behavior::PathEndX(), Object.Behavior::PathEndY()) / GetArgumentAsNumber("RepetitionCount")

parameters.longDescription: The path can be define with the "Append curve" action.
parameters.name: PathName

parameters.longDescription: The path can be define with the "Append curve" action.

DistanceBetweenPositions(Object.X(), Object.Y(), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationY")) / DistanceBetweenPositions(0, 0, Object.Behavior::PathEndX(), Object.Behavior::PathEndY()) / Object.Behavior::PropertyRepetitionCount()
